column1: Bhindar (also spelt Bhinder) is a tehsil of Udaipur district in Rajasthan
column2: India. The tehsil headquarter is located in the town of Bhinder.

column1: Before the formation of the Republic of India
column2: the territory of present-day Bhindar tehsil was part of the former Udaipur State. With the formation of the United State of Rajasthan (precursor to the state of Rajasthan) in 1948
column3: the new district of Udaipur was constituted which included the territory of present-day Bhindar tehsil.In 1959
column4: the sub-tehsil of Bhindar was created within Vallabhnagar tehsil. After a nearly 40-year long struggle by local activists to obtain tehsil status

column1: The area of Bhindar tehsil is 341 square kilometres. The annual average rainfall in the tehsil is 608 mm
column2: with an average of 30 rainy days per year.16 villages of the tehsil that are in the vicinity of the city of the Udaipur urban area are subject to the jurisdiction urban planning policies of the Udaipur Urban Improvement Trust.
